Name: Dice Hospital: Inspector Administrator Promo Card
Description:
Administrator card for Dice Hospital.

Backers of the Coral Islands Kickstarter received this promo for free if they Kickstarted Dice Hospital.

It features a new one-time only ability and Sabrina Miramon has captured the likeness of Tom Vasel for the upcoming Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Once per game you may remove this card from the game during the improvement phase. When it is your turn to choose an improvement, instead, you may look through the specialist card deck and take a specialist of your choice as your improvement that round

Name: DropMix: Playlist Pack (Fantastic)
Description:
Expand the possibilities of dropmix the fantastic playlist pack comes with 15 dropmix cards, Plus 1 hidden track card. Each card adds new tracks to add to your mix, whether you unleash your inner DJ with freestyle mode or go head to head with your friends in the player versus player game modes.

Bounce to the epic beats the fantastic playlist includes fast-paced dance tracks to move along to the beat. Mix and match the cards with your dropmix collection and let the music flow. This playlist includes music from: axwell/\ingrosso, Blondie, DJ khaled, haddaway, Rick James, Sia, soft cell, and more.

Bring the ultimate party game to your next party or enjoy dropmix at home, at game night, or just hanging out with friends. Share it with friends and family, or play solo. With three fun game modes that support One to four players, in versus or co-op, the music mixes that you'll make will keep the fun going.

The FX cards are "Cover the Bases," a Level 3 that yields an extra point if played in an empty mix slot (yawn), and "Loop the Loop," a Level 2 that "Blocks All Red Cards." Blocking is a completely new mechanic.

Name: DropMix: Playlist Pack (Instinct)
Description:
Expand the possibilities of dropmix the fantastic playlist pack comes with 15 dropmix cards, Plus 1 hidden track card. Each card adds new tracks to add to your mix, whether you unleash your inner DJ with freestyle mode or go head to head with your friends in the player versus player game modes.

Includes:

PSY - Gangnam Style
Charlie Puth - Attention
Maroon 5 - Animals
Eddie Japan - When Things Fall Apart
BABYMETAL - Gimme Chocolate!!
Brain Beater - Power Sick
Danny Ocean - Me Rehuso

The FX cards in the pack are "With the Pack," a Level 2 that lets you draw a card if played on top of a yellow card, and "In the Air," a Level 3 that gives you 2 points if you have both a blue and a green on the board.

Name: Sagas of Mistal
Description:
"Sagas of Mistal" is a 4X strategy game happening in a classic medieval fantasy theme, combining Area-control opposition, Economic, Auction and Building mechanics, with complex victory conditions (a kind of Civilization game, where there are multiple ways of winning).

A game is lasting about 120 minutes and can be played by 4 players (possibly less or more with other maps). The original intended target audience was the expert gamers, but after heaps of blind tests, it seems to have a wider audience than expected (family+).

We believe the hooks of this game are the following:


     Replay value: it's a rich, balanced and complex game, with many options of play
     Intuitive and friendly: rules are quite easy to get, the prototype's design is catchy
     Fun and cognitive: an area-control and economic game with dice, which is "telling stories"


The project is two years old, and has been playtested over 250 times (private sessions, blind tests, game festivals, game bars..). We value balancing and testing a lot, and we reckon this game has a good potential for editing.

—description from the designers

Name: Filharmonia
Description:
A game published by The Szczecin Philharmonic Orchestra, about ...philharmony. You have to match musicians with instruments and compositions to gest them to play a concert. All that with cards, dice and a board. And a little bit of negative interaction.

In the box (nicely finished in matte), you get a 4 page instruction, a board with 57 squares, 4 cardboard pawns (with plastic clip-on bases), 50 "Musician" cards, 50 "Music piece" cards, 50 "Musical instrument" cards, 50 "Event" or "Occurrence" cards, 18 "Concert" tokens, 18 "Golden treble clef" tokens and a six-sided dice. The goal of the game is to get 5 "Golden treble" tokens (or 3 in the shorter game variant). 
Players actions consist of a dice roll, movement (either clockwise or counter clockwise), and performing the action listed on the space of the board (kind of like in Talisman  ). The board spaces consist of actions like: draw a card from indicated pile, gain or lose a token, use a shortcut, exchange a card with other player and so on. The "Event" cards change the course of the game. You can use such card as soon as you draw one, or leave it for later (depending on the card). Example: "Thanks to your hard work, the orchestra will play at a festival abroad. You get a 'Concert' token". 
"Music piece" cards should be matched with "Musicians" and "Instruments" - for example "Music piece: Chopin - Prelude in E minor. Instrument needed: piano" -> you have to find a musician who plays piano, like "Miss Wanda. A piano expert", and a "Instrument" card with a piano. One musician can often play more than one instrument, but there's a twist: for example you can get a pianist, but he only plays one composer's pieces, or he doesn't play Chopin's or Mozart's or someone's music. "Instruments" cards (50 cards, but 16 types of instruments) include some technical/historical info; "Musicians" cards are quite funny in polish. If you get 3 such matching cards (music piece, musician, instrument), you get a "Concert" token. Then you have to get to a "Practice room" field on the board (there's two of them; roll a dice or use a shortcut). When you get there, you discard the "Concert" token and get the "Golden clef".

—user summary

Name: Dino Dig: Risky Sites
Description:
Dino Dig: Risky Sites is a risk and chance set collection game, where players "dig" to find the most dinosaur fossils in a scorpion infested desert. To guide you along the way, each player has a tool box full of helpful equipment. Will you risk digging for valuable dinosaurs and maybe face scorpions? Or will you play it safe and hope to win by digging for smaller fossils? Find out if you are the best paleontologist!

Set up the game by laying out the Dirt cards in a 5x5 grid, 3 layers deep. Then each player takes his 5 Tool cards and sends his paleontologist to any Dig Site.

On their turn, players can take 2 actions in any order or combination: move 1 space, dig 1 tile, or play a Tool card. The game ends when a designated number of Dig Sites have been emptied, triggering the end round.

When the game is over, players add up their score. The more complete a fossil is, the more points it will be worth. But make sure not to get any scorpions! 
  
—description from the designer

Name: Charley Harper's Spot the Birds
Description:
Grab your binoculars and keep an eagle eye to the sky with Charley Harper’s Spot the Birds. It’ll be a hoot! Peregrinate through the board’s five habitats—the Backyard, the Desert, the Woodland, the Wetland, and the Shores—and track each bird you spot by collecting the tokens for each space you land on and placing the token on your birder's journal. Roll the die to see how many spaces you move along the outer loop (the habitat loop).

Along the way, you’ll discover how to be a good bird steward. But watch out—you’ll need to dodge storms, avoid falling in a river, and beware of birds that poop on your head (it happens). All of these will negatively impact your turn, in some cases sending you backward or in other cases making you put a token back, and some will have a global impact on all players.

The game has three different levels to play at, from standard to more difficult. Once you spot the required number of birds, which is determined at the beginning of the game, then the game becomes a race to the finish. Turn up one of the four trails to the Bird Sanctuary and be the first to reach the end and you’ll rule the roost!

Name: Jokes de Papa: version Salée
Description: In this Salty version you will find 200 jokes of (very) bad taste for a good slice of laughter between consenting adults!

Name: Jokes de Papa: version Sucrée
Description: In this Sweet version you will find 200 jokes specially chosen to spend a memorable moment with your family!

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Black Order
Description: Vs System 2PCG: Black Order, the final installment in the three-part Vs. System 2PCG Infinity War arc, is a boost for the forces of evil. Infamous villains Thanos, Nebula, Mistress Death and others have arrived to wage war on the universe. Is your deck strong enough to stop them? Don't let Thanos gain control of the Infinity Gauntlet…unless of course you are Thanos!

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Cosmic Avengers
Description:
Earth’s Mightiest Heroes take to space in this new expansion to Vs. System 2PCG.

This expansion is the first issue of the Infinity War story Arc and brings a lot of strength to the Avengers team. Black Panther, Captain Marvel and Hawkeye showing up as Main Characters in this set with Captain Marvel being able to power up to Level 3.

This set also features two new firsts; Locations and Plot Twists that your Main Character can utilize as powers.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Galactic Guardians
Description:
Joining forces with the Guardians of the Galaxy is a host of powerful heroes used to waging battle in the cosmos! Add heroes like Adam Warlock, Cosmo and Star Lord to your deck and stop the enemy in its tracks.

This is not a standalone game.

Name: Star Ride
Description:
Star Ride is a board game where players travel though the zodiac and major star constellations. Players move a circular path around the board and have 4 star playing pieces which can jump to a zodiac constellation and onto the major stars in that constellation. The winner is the player who reaches the North Star first.

—user summary

Name: Trade
Description:
Ever want to navigate the seas? Travel the world? Run your own company? In TRADE, the board game, you can do it all: make decisions, be your own boss, and sail to victory! In this exciting new game of strategy and negotiations, you transport back to the 18th century in order to be in command of your own trading company. This international business is all about the gold, but watch out for your gold hungry opponents! With the roll of the dice, the selection of a port where you're destined to carry the purchased goods on your ship, and the luck of the winds - you can win it all! Beware of the adventures, fun, and laughs that are likely to occur along the journey.

From the box:

TRADE - The new exciting game of strategy, negotiations, and fun.

Can you navigate the high seas? Run your own company? Build the ultimate trading empire? In TRADE, the board game, you can do it all! Brave the rough Atlantic Ocean, make decisions, and sail to victory!

In this exciting game of strategy and negotiations, you return to the 18th century to amass riches in international trade. With the roll of the dice, you select a port where you purchase goods for your ship to carry. Next you transport these goods across the sea, for sale. Get ready for many adventures along the way!

Gameplay overview from rule sheet:

The basic premise of TRADE is simple: you enter a port with one of your ships, buy one of the goods that the port exports, transport that good across the sea, and then sell that good in a port that imports it.


     You get 2 ships.
     There are 6 goods available for trade: Sugar, Tea, Lumber, Rum, Molasses, and Wheat.
     A ship can carry at most 5 loads of goods.
     There are 6 ports (Boston, Charleston, Kingston, London, Lisbon, Africa).
     You can purchase a dock at any port which cuts your purchase price for goods in half at that port.
     Each turn roll 4 dice and divy those results up between your 2 ships.
     There are 6 trans-Atlantic routes.
     Each route goes through a central Hurricane space you want to avoid ending your turn on.
     Along each route are "A" spaces. If you land on those you draw Adventure cards that can be a Task or a Demand. Tasks are missions you can complete for rewards. Demands represent the economic climate and change values of goods. Players vote to keep current Demands or adopt the new Demands.
     You can sabotage opponent ships if you are in the same space by paying gold to destroy their goods.
     If a player lands on the Hurricane, all ships not in a port are drawn towards the hurricane.
     You can bribe other players in exchange for non-binding verbal agreements (votes, etc.)
     Play continues until the last Adventure card is drawn. Highest score wins.

Name: De Bello Galactico
Description:
De Bello Galactico puts you in control of one the interstellar civilizations competing for galactic supremacy. To prevail, you will need to explore and colonize new star systems, build space ships, research new technologies, politicize in the galactic council, and keep your population happy.

There are many routes to victory; smart plotting and investing in the right political Agenda could secure your political supremacy, or you might science your way to the top, uniting the galaxy in a holistic singularity event. You might slowly plod to economic predominance. An aggressive colonization strategy with the support of your population could secure your superior power, as would the military domination of one of the other big intergalactic players. Reading which path your opponents follow and outsmarting them is key to victory.

De Bello Galactico is a straightforward and streamlined true 4X space game. The vast interstellar distances covered are baked into the Hyperspace movement system, doing away with the need for a board. Each Faction has different upgradeable ships, as well as a different way to handle their population. Thanks to a staggered action and pass system, downtime is minimal and rounds flow fast.

—description from the designer

Name: Operation Apollo
Description:
Operation Apollo is a race to the moon and back published late 1960s. The game has a 3 dimensional metal earth and moon embedded into the board and 2 roulette wheels. The spaceship playing pieces separate into 3 stages (rocket, command and lunar module). The lunar module is magnetic to stick to the moon.

By the spin of the roulette wheel players leave earth and travel in an orbital path to the moon, needing to land on certain spots to enter a moon orbit and landing. The playing pieces separate on landing, with the Command module remaining in lunar orbit. The lunar module lands on the moon and remains. Players then travel back to earth needing to re-enter at a critical point. If their spaceship overshoots your lost in space and out the game. The first to have their command module back to earth is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Valuable Vases
Description:
Valuable Vases is a fun lightweight social deduction party game. Plays compete to collect all types of vases by “stealing” them from other players. But get caught stealing the wrong vase and you may end up with more loss than gain.

Story: While coming back from selling what you stole, in the market you were tired. Walking home in the dark night, the moonlight shows you your path. From the street you see a shiny white ceramic vase sitting on a window sill. Your steal for today was over but the thief in you provokes, saying “ An extra sell will help tomorrow”. As everyone is asleep you tip toe and slide the vase in your bag. A few steps ahead you see another Blue vase and carefully slip that as well.

You escape the house well, but just as you step out you bump into another black hooded thief. With a sly smile he asks “What have you got in your bag?”

—description from the designer

Name: Unicorn Hoopla
Description: The box contains two unicorn headbands and six decorated rings. The headbands have a unicorn horn on them so when you are wearing one you become a unicorn. Each player wears a headband and takes three rings. The layers then take it in turns to throw their rings at the other players unicorn horn. Whichever player gets the most rings over the other player’s horn is the winner.

Name: The Police Board Game: TOP COP
Description:
Do you think you have the reflexes, stamina and mental fortitude to be the top of the city’s finest?

In The POLICE Board Game – TOP COP, 2 to 6 players take on the role of patrol officers striving for the title of “Top Cop”.  Try to keep the streets of the city safe from crimes (labeled as "PERPs") that Dispatch will identify throughout the five sectors of the map.  Players take turns patrolling the city attempting to stop crimes by taking on three different types of challenges (Driving, Physical, & Verbal), aided by equipment and partners helping to get the job done, all the while juggling the stacks of paperwork that the DA’s Office will need filed to prosecute the criminals. Be careful of getting stuck doing paperwork; because if too many perps get off the board, the city will fall into anarchy and the Mayor’s Office won’t be happy!

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Horror Movie Edition
Description:
Perfect for thrill seekers and know-it-alls alike, TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Horror Movie Edition is a must-have for any game collection. Just when you thought it was safe, both specific details and multiple choices await to attack based on films such as Jaws, The Exorcist, The Hills Have Eyes, and A Nightmare on Elm Street. Whether your best bet is on a variety of slashers, bloodbaths, or mutants, test your wits on the titles that keep you up at night with TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Horror Movie Edition

Stand alone "wedge" box of horror-themed trivia. Contains 600 questions on 100 cards and a six sided die representing the categories of question.

Categories: Monster, Gore/Disturbing, Psychological, Paranormal, Slasher, and International.

Name: Furloughed Friends: A Government Shutdown Game
Description:
The shutdown continues. Federal government agencies are closed over disagreements for funding to build a wall along the southern border of the United States. Tension is mounting in DC and Americans across the country are and struggling from inability to access certain services.  See if you can make a deal or build the wall before our elected officials!

Players are divided into Team Democrat and Team Republican. Democrats win by passing appropriation bills to reopen the closed agencies before Republicans secure funding for the wall. Republicans win by securing funding for the wall before Democrats reopen closed agencies. Players reopen agencies/build the wall by advancing spaces along the board which has a map of DC with federal buildings and the southern border of the United States. Individual players can also negotiate to reach a deal.

Either party can win if it receives a 70 percent or higher approval rating based how they play their cards to win the hearts and minds of the American public.

—description from the designer

Name: Storm Over Dublin
Description:
On Easter Monday, 24th April 1916, the Irish Volunteer Force, Cumann na mBan, Fianna na hÉireann and Irish Citizen Army gathered at their mustering points across Dublin. 1,200 men, women and boy scouts seized control of the city centre, and at noon Patrick Pearce stood on the steps of the GPO and proclaimed the Irish Republic to a stunned crowd. Hopes that the British would be too preoccupied on the Western Front to deal with Ireland were soon dashed. Troops flooded in from Athlone, Belfast, the Curragh and Liverpool. The Rebels were outnumbered by ten to one, but held out for a week as Dublin was reduced to rubble.

The Irish War of Independence (1919-21) ended with the partition of Ireland into North and South. This was accepted by the Provisional Government led by Mike Collins, but rejected by the IRA who wanted to unite all of Ireland in a Republic. Collins was given artillery by the British Army, surrounded the IRA HQ at the Four Courts and fired the first shots of the Irish Civil War on 28th June 1922. The Four Courts fell two days later, but it took another week to drive the IRA out of Dublin.

Storm Over Dublin is an Area/Impulse game of the 1916 Easter Rising and 1922 Battle of Dublin. The Rebel Player must seize strategic buildings across Dublin and hold them against the odds. The Government Player must take back control of the city block by block, using cavalry, infantry, artillery, gunboats, bombers, tanks, and armoured cars, even if the city is reduced to ruins. Each side earns victory points for controlling areas and capturing enemy Leaders and Units. The Government Player needs a substantive lead as the rebels are court-martialled at the end of the game, and their martyrdom may sway the public opinion and give them victory.

—description from the designer

Name: Catan: Big Box
Description: The 2019 edition of Catan: Big Box contains the classic Catan board game, along with the expansion that allows up to six players to compete on the base game, the Catan Dice Game, the Frenemies scenario, the Helpers of Catan mini-expansion that gives each player a character with a bonus ability, the Corsica scenario (printed on paper), and the New York scenario (printed on paper).
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Die drei ??? Kids: Auf Verbrecherjagd
Description: Die drei ??? Kids: Auf Verbrecherjagd requires detective sense and teamwork as the three young investigators — Justus, Peter and Bob — have seven suspects before them in this latest case. Ingenious combinations are required before the players will be able to unmark the true perpetrators and click on the handcuffs...

Name: One Week Ultimate Bonus Pack A
Description:
Expansion for use with One Week Ultimate Werewolf.

The expansion contains three new rooms with special abilities:

     Bottomless Pit
     Dungeon
     Venus Grotto

Name: Ludus Senatus
Description:
Ludus Senatus, designed by Brian Compter,  takes its inspiration from the Roman Senate. Players control a tableau of three cards and take turns either revealing one of their cards and performing the actions listed on it or placing a card in the middle of the table and drawing a new card face-down to their tableau. When the center of the table fills up with the appropriate amount of cards each player checks the votes on their cards and compares them to the votes in the middle of the table. If the majority of their votes matches the majority of votes in the middle than the player scores points.

Contents:
18 Poker Cards
Folding Box/Rules

—description from the publisher

Name: In Her Majesty's Name: The Rise of Akhenaton
Description:
In Her Majesty's Name: The Rise of Akhenaton is set in a Steampunk world of 1895, the players represent the major nations of the Victorian era competing for both mechanical & mystical advantage.

Three decks of cards (Destination, Mission & Adversary) create challenges all around the world and the players compete to accumulate Fame Points by travelling to destinations and claiming the cards for successfully completing the challenge at that location.
Challenges involve Shooting, Fighting or Mystic traits; they are resolved using a dice roll adjusted by skill level, 'Operation' cards played and money spent.

During a challenge all players can opt to play cards to either help or hinder the current player.
Six of the challenges in the game involve the 'Regalia of Ra', if players obtain these items they increase their Mystic powers.
However Akhenaton’s agents are also searching for the Regalia of Ra and on every player’s turn all regalia in play will move towards their headquarters in Cairo, if a regalia item reaches Cairo then Akhenaton claims it.

When the sixth regalia item is revealed Akhenaton himself appears on the board and moves on London, if he reaches London he wins, if he is defeated then the player with the most Fame Points wins.

—description from the designer

Feedback from playtester Mark T
“it’s an atmospheric, retro experience with simple, fast, well balanced, logical game play. We all loved the subtle balance of co-op and every man for himself. The pain of taking one for the team by compromising an intended mission to help someone else pick up a Regalia rather than let it get to Cairo makes for some fantastic gameplay with all the deal making/breaking that goes with that.
The end game is a lovely ramping of tension and the option of going for total loss rather than helping someone who has previously screwed you over win outright is also a very nice/nasty touch.”

Name: Adventure Post: Adrift
Description:
Adventure Post is a series of solo-mini-adventures delivered to your door on a postcard each week. Every week is a small portion of an overall larger campaign which will take many, many weeks to come to conclusion. The postcard will include a QR code or website address that will direct you to the weekly adventure document. The document will explain the setup, instructions, and key areas on the adventure map.

Adrift uses simplistic dice rolls for combat and interacting with the world. You play a the crew of the USF Montoya as they battle to keep their ship operational and sleeping passengers safe from harm.

The Story:
The USF “Montoya” has a skeleton crew in operation, while the colony of “Unnamed” remain in cryo-stasis, Shortly after a burn
manoeuvre the “Montoya” had a major impact, the cause is likely to be a derelict or rogue asteroid.
Alarms have sounded and the command crew have woken all available crew to restore vital functions. The ships log recorded by the Computer “TREVOR” recorded the above. TREVOR has suggested to you the Captain:
1: Engineering to survey hull for breaches.
2: Restore the main power.
3: Navigation to restore Subspace.
4: geometrics to find location.
5: Analyse Cryo-stasis systems and stabilise.
6: Security, a small squad of Federation Marines to secure the ship and repel borders if required.
7: Engineering to re-engage Hyperlight drive.

Adrift is only the first adventure in a larger overall campaign. There are more adventures of different themes and new rules on the horizon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Istanbul or Constantinople?
Description:
A city with many names over the years and many opinions on those names. Istanbul or Constantinople? sees 1-4 players attempting to sway the streets into lining up with their favorite name for their city. Double sided cards featuring two numbers on each side are dealt out into five lines known as "streets". The value of each card is different depending on it's position and what side is face up on the table. Each turn a player or team of players may choose to flip a card over, swap and rotate cards in two different streets, or switch a card in a street with one in their hand.

When the right-side-up numbers in a street sum up to certain values the player may score that street, gaining points equal to the highest card played in the street. Once all streets have been scored the game ends and the player with the highest point total wins.

Contents:
18 Poker Cards
Folding Box/Rules

—description from the publisher

Name: Janko
Description:
Each player sets his numbered tokens on the corresponding spaces with the white dots. The players roll the die once a turn and sets the token with the rolled number on the space with the black dots. If a player rolls a number, where the token is already on the space with the black dots, he has to pay a coin into the cash box. If a player rolls a 6 he may roll again. If he rolls another 6, he wins all coins from the cash box.

The first player to to get all 6 tokens to the spaces with the black dots, wins half the coins from the cash box. The last player to achieve this gets the remaining coins from the cash box.

—user summary

Name: Brook City: Keys to the Kingdom Expansion
Description:
An exclusive Kickstarter crossover expansion featuring the characters from Street Masters, Ying Hua, Ah Long, and the White Lotus crew. This expansion not only gives you an Exclusive new case and suspect, but also a new cop (with her deck) and introduces her Sprinter D vehicle w/miniature that thematically drifts around corners of Brook City!  And for those returning from Street Masters, there are 3 cards that come with this expansion that allow these 3 characters to be playable in Street Masters as rival/allies.

The Keys to the Kingdom expansion is an Exclusive, meaning that it will have a very limited print run and will not be a part of mass retail distribution. Only available from the Kickstarter, Pledge Manager, and through the publisher directly at conventions or online until inventory is gone. After that, it won't be reprinted again.

Components: 1 cop miniature, 1 suspect miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 4 vehicle miniatures, 71 cards (25 cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 case cards, 4 vehicle cards, 3 ally/rival crossover cards

Name: Brook City: Delta Keys
Description:
Join the Murdock brothers as they visit the beautiful islands of the Delta Keys, facing off against a new criminal and two new cases, as well as a new island sideboard.

Components: 2 cop miniatures, 1 suspect miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 145 cards (25x2 Cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 x2 Case cards, 25 Smuggling cards, 6 vehicle cards), side board, tokens, and rulebook

Name: Brook City: Velocity Expansion
Description:
A mad bomber has caused mayhem all over town, blowing up landmarks and government institutions. While she has yet to harm anyone in the process, the damage she's causing to the city is nigh catastrophic. With all this chaos and destruction going on in Brook City, the BCPD can use any help it can get. Chance Mitchell has taken this opportunity to get some hands on experience with law enforcement for his upcoming cop movie. That’s right, Chance is a famous actor doing research for a new film, but gets caught up in real world cop work in the mean streets of Brook City.

In Velocity, the cops face a new criminal in the form of Leeta Wix, a street orphan from nearby Ransom City with an explosive attitude. Her crimes are focused on evacuating important buildings in Brook City so she can blow them to the ashes, proving to the Syndicate that she's a much better asset to their organization than a liability. Meanwhile, the cops have to solve a new dangerous case. Someone has strapped a civilian bus with enough explosives to send it into the atmosphere. What's worse? If the bus stops, it blows! So the cops have to carefully navigate a speeding bus, represented on the board by a detailed plastic miniature, along the streets of Brook City while preventing collateral damage from spelling their destruction.

The Velocity Expansion introduces a new modular element to Brook City in the form of wrecks. While these plastic wreck markers can be used in any game, they are specifically designed to augment the included "Velocity" case. With the wreck deck, any time a cop is forced to lose their vehicle, it crashes and causes a wreck. Wrecks block the streets and cause additional stress to cops; meaning if they don't clean up the streets, they'll get fired in no time!

Components: 1 bus miniature, 1 cop miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 12 wrecks, 82 cards (25 cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 case cards, 14 wreck cards)

Name: Brook City: The Sixth Cycle
Description:
On the backstreets of Brook City evil is brewing: an artist who sculpts not in clay but in the flesh of murdered victims. The police of Brook City will have to play a dangerous game of cat and mouse to decipher the killer's clues and save its citizens. But will they bring this deranged perp to justice or end up as just another layer in the killer's ultimate masterpiece?

The Sixth Cycle adds a new perspective to Brook City that is completely compatible with the Brook City base game. It features Earl Thompson, a brilliant but jaded detective whose insight and experience prove invaluable in solving Brook City’s toughest cases, and Mercy, a charismatic leader who guides the demented and deranged of Brook City on their unholy path.

"The Vitruvian Man" is a chilling case of intrigue and suspense that will keep you on your toes and awake at night. Can you save the city, or will you be the killer's next victim?

Components: 1 cop miniature, 1 suspect miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 82 cards (25 cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 case cards)

Name: Pinch ‘n' Pass
Description:
Battle with your opponents and the buzzer in this quick-thinking, fast-paced game of categories. How many famous actors, pizza topping, things that are red, or breeds of dog can you name under pressure?

‘Pinch’ and ‘pass’ category cards differ in that you try to snag pinch cards from other players by shouting out something from the category and you try to get rid of pass cards hot-potato style by saying something from the category.

Whoever’s left holding the card when the buzzer goes off reaps the benefit (for pinch cards) or suffering the penalty (for pass cards). First player to the finish line is the winner, but don’t get knocked out for getting caught with too many pass cards!

Each player may also call another player out for a head-to-head round. You can only do it once, so make it count!

Name: Expancity: Dice Tower Cruise Promo Tile
Description:
This tile was given out at Dice Tower Cruise 3. The art features the Independence of the Seas cruise ship.

"Keep this Cruise tile aside at the start of the game. The first player to score 12 or more points on any building, places the Cruise tile as a free action, connected to at least one tile by road. Tiles may not be played on the water sides."

Name: Jungle Rummy
Description:
Jungle Rummy is a casual card game for 2-4 people, which takes elements of Hearts, Rummy, and Uno, and transforms them with a Jungle themed twist. The scoring system creates a set of constantly changing objectives, and the interaction between players can be frenzied and passionate.

—user summary

Name: Le jeu des incollables
Description:
French game of questions with a typical course "Game of the Goose" of which each box, will define the theme of the question which will be put to you.
The winner is of course, the one who finishes the course first.
The difference with other question sets is that the questions are calibrated here according to the level of the player.
Each card offers a question for each grade level from CP to CM2 and a question for older adults and adults.

Name: El tanque the bite game
Description:
Fight against other sharks for being the winner of the best food, the tank is small and the sharks are very focused on their decisions.

In this competitive dexterity and skill game, each player is a shark that seeks to obtain the greatest and best investment in food, for this account with your jaws and your agility.
The dice dictate what type of food to take before others.
The shark with the most points in its chips will be the winner at the end of the game.

Name: Latuvu
Description:
To play smart by car or train ... Today children spend more and more hours by car or train. Latuvu is a wonderful way to observe the landscape while playing. This is to identify in the landscape that unfolds before our eyes, the illustrations on the cards. The cards drawn are captioned in English and French ...

In each round a card is drawn and then the first person who sees the corresponding thing shown on the card scores one point. The game ends after an predefined time or score.

Name: Industrial Board Game
Description:
A board game in which the processes of a manufacturing company is simulated, from the purchase, transformation of material into consumer goods, until its sale. Throughout this process players must also improve their factory by adding strategic departments and developing improvements that affect the reduction of production costs, maintenance, etc.

Each shift consists of four phases:

First phase, Purchase:
A purchase price of a raw material is marked with a 1d6 and each player buys the one they deem appropriate.

Second phase, Manufacturing:
Each player will transform the raw material into final products according to the production capacity of their factory.

Third phase, sale:
A base price for the sale of products will be marked and each player will have to fight against the competition by rolling dice according to the improvements that have been applied in their commercial department and will charge based on the improvements applied to the benefits for product sold that provide tools of departments like quality or engineering.

Fourth phase, maintenance and incident cards:
Each player must pay the maintenance of their buildings and the salary of the workers used based on the improvements applied to reduce these costs and then acquire a card of incidents which generates a disadvantage or random reward.

The game is marked with event cards that simulate economic cycles, which apply particular conditions in each round. For example, a year of economic boom may have more subsidies and a year of crisis prices fall. You can choose between playing 7 or 10 rounds.

At the end of the event deck, the game ends and points are counted based on the departments built, tools developed, materials in storage, and money in cash.

Board game as playful as training, developed for players but that contains an integrated training base that is valid to discover the operation of a company for every body.

This game has been endorsed by several companies in sectors such as training, renewable energies, occupational safety, supplies and installations.

-description from designer

Name: Outer Space
Description:
Simple roll and move space game where players travel though the solar system. Starting at the sun players maybe assisted on their journey by landing on the planets. Players may also advance or be sent back to planets by landing on specific spots. The first to reach Pluto is the winner. Although not dated, the graphics suggest the game was published around the late 50s to early 60s.

—user summary

Name: Turtle
Description: Turtle is a dice game where the object is to be the last player remaining on the turtle race track. The race track is one hundred feet long. As soon as a player crosses the finish line that player is out of the game.

Name: Twisted Fate: The card game
Description:
Gather your friends and family and choose your characters to beat the odds together in this fate twisting game.
Immersive story, unique mechanics and great visual craft that allows you to create strategies, mess with other players' fates and try to win points accordingly to your Fate Card.

The mechanics are pretty simple: 
There are 6 characters, each one with its own ability. Each player will have to draw a Fate Card that will establish their fate during the game, basically, it will tell what cards to keep.

The game has 9 rounds, but it can be disrupted by 2 very awesome cards.
From the deck of cards, there are to be shuffled 3 cards per round to each participant.

Playtime: 10-15 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tourni Badou
Description:
Do you have an elephant's memory? Test your memory with Tourni Badou! Make Badou turn and follow his instructions carefully: "A card!", Two cards!" or "Close your eyes!". Each turn players turn one or two cards. The first who collects all the cards corresponding to his character is the winner!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Canine Kleptomaniacs
Description:
Canine Kleptomaniacs is a simple, silly, addictive, doggy card game that celebrates the bizarre thieving habits of our canine friends.

Like the average, faithful family hound, Canine Kleptomaniacs is unashamedly simple. It doesn't employ sophisticated gameplay or in-depth strategy. But don't think because of this that it isn't great fun and endlessly re-playable.

It's all about Pooch Points.

You score Pooch Points by doing what comes naturally to all Canine Kleptomaniacs – thieving and hiding underwear, socks, slippers and anything else that takes your fancy.

Choosing what to collect, when to hide and whether and what to trade with other players (as well as having luck along the way) will ultimately determine your fortunes in this silly, fun, fast-paced, simple-to-learn, family-and-dog-friendly card game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Step Right Up
Description:
A carnival-themed roll and move that promises players will "learn carny language", among other thrilling benefits.

—user summary

Name: Paraphrase: Songs In Other Words
Description:
Paraphrase: Songs in Other Words is a party game where song titles are cleverly disguised through the art of paraphrasing.

Solve the word puzzles, show off your knowledge of song titles, and maybe even win the respect of your fellow teammates with your amazing singing ability! Points are earned by correctly solving the Paraphrase and naming the Song Title. Extra points are earned by correctly guessing the Artist/Band who made it a hit in that decade and/or suddenly burst into song. If you need hints, you will lose points. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ring der Magier
Description: In Ring der Magier, players want to throw or hit a magnetic ring onto colored crystal fields to charge their own ring board with crystals. Whoever first has eight crystals on their rings wins.

Name: Demon Arm
Description:
Demon Arm is a solitaire gamebook originally written for the November 2012 24-Hour Design Contest about a quest for freedom and revenge. Huko is a soldier-turned-ronin who is cursed by the sorcerer Kulaki. A demon partially possesses Huko.

In the game, you play as Huko, fighting for control over your demon arm as you sneak into Kulaki's fortress to force him to exorcise your demon--or, barring that, to exact your revenge.

As you progress through the game, you will be forced to use your demon arm to help you fight, climb, and break into the fortress. Each time you do, the demon can get stronger. If it gets too strong, you could lose your free will and become consumed by the demon.

—description from the designer

Name: A Journey of Conviction
Description:
Betrayed by your lord and friend, you have been sentenced to death for the assassination of your lord’s fiancée. Determined to clear your name and avenge the lady’s death, you vow to escape your cell, flee to safety, reveal and slay the true assassin, and duel your lord in order to regain your honor. This is your journey.

Required Components


     The postcard (with maps and rules)
     The bookmark (with actions and stats)
     A pencil with eraser
     Any paperback book with 300+ pages


The Gameplay

The game is simple. Each turn, riffle through the pages of the book without looking at the page numbers and quickly insert the bookmark. The number in the "hundreds" place will determine your action for the turn. If you land on page 1-99, then the hundreds place is "0".

If your action is to move, you may only move across dotted lines, never through solid lines. You may move onto spaces containing enemies, but you may not move OUT of spaces with enemies unless those enemies have been defeated. The exception to this is retreating--if you are instructed to retreat and are adjacent to or on the same space as an enemy, you may move 1 space in any direction.

If your action is to attack, the number in the "ones" place will determine which type of attack you use.

Once your action is resolve, the number in the "tens" place may force you to add additional enemies to the map. You choose where to place the enemy. You cannot place enemies in occupied spaces unless all spaces are occupied.

If you must ever choose between one page number and another, choose the page with the most text.

Finally, check the positions of all enemies on the map. If any of them are in range, they attack you.

You win the game if you complete all levels and defeat the Lord.

You lose the game if your Life ever becomes zero.

—description from the publisher

Name: Medieval Traders
Description:
It’s the turn of the 9th century, near the end of the Dark Ages. Peasants have newfound hope of escaping the rigid feudal social structure by embracing the path of the merchant. Through the acquisition of wealth and the expanding dependency on their goods, merchants could sometimes elevate themselves to occupy a distinguished position amidst the upper social hierarchy. Although the life of a merchant had its attractive sides, impediments such as war, weather and taxes all came as a counterpart to their ambitious course of life.

In Medieval Traders, you play the role of a peasant aspiring to become a wealthy merchant and escape the life of the hard-working laborer. The merchant that attains the most wealth and achievements, measured in victory points, is considered to be the winner. By buying resources common to one part of the known world and traveling to sell them in another or by fulfilling trade opportunities in various trade locations, players are able to distinguish themselves amongst their peers and amass the necessary funds to purchase assets of wealth and prestige. However be wary, as the travel routes are full of perils and the nobles will undoubtedly seek to collect their taxes and dues. But let us not disregard that sometimes good fortune may sprinkle itself upon the venturous…

Name: Superhero Meeples
Description:
Assemble your superhero team to defeat encounters and earn the most honor! Rescue bystanders, capture henchmen, and form a plan to defeat the evil meeples terrorizing the city. A drafting card game that is easy to learn, quick to play, and fun for the whole family.

How To Play:
Players will draft cards to assemble their team of superheroes. Without revealing their cards to the other players, each player looks at the 9 cards they were dealt, selects one, and places it face down in front of them until all players have selected their card. Players then take all of the remaining cards (now 8) and passes them to the player on their left (who also is passing their cards to their left).

Then, starting with the player with the "First Player Card" and continuing clockwise around the table, each player takes a turn choosing either to:

     Play the card drafted


 or

     Discard the card drafted and attempt to win an encounter


If they Play the Card Drafted, they turn their card face-up and resolve any effects on the card (Example: the cards says “Gain a bystander.” They would pick up one of the purple bystander tokens and place it in front of them.)

If they Discard the card drafted and attempt to win an encounter, the player places the drafted card face-up in a discard pile in the middle of the table. They then attempt to win an Encounter, seeing if they are able to meet the requirements of one of the face-up Encounters. If they are able to do so, they place the defeated Encounter face-up in their play area. If the encounter had any special text on it, resolve those now. (Examples of special text: “Discard two superheroes” or “Gain a planning token”)

After ALL players have revealed their drafted card and resolved any special card abilities, replenish any Encounters that were defeated from the face up available Encounters. Then the players pick up the stack of cards that were passed to them from their right. Repeat the process of choosing a card until all cards have been drafted.

After the last cards are drafted, players count up the Honor (Victory points) they earned. Add all Honor earned from defeated Encounters, rescued Bystanders (each purple bystander token is one honor), and any additional Honor from any Ally cards drafted (Allies do not have an icon in the top left corner and also refer to “At end of round…”). The player with the most Honor is the winner!

TYPES OF CARDS AND TOKENS
Superheroes - There are four types of Superhero cards: Strong (green fist), Telepathic (blue eye), Fast (yellow bolt), and Flying (pink wing).

Allies – Allies give additional Honor at the end of the round if certain conditions were met. Allies do NOT count as Superheroes and may not be used to help defeat encounters. Allies do not have an icon in the top corner (also, the art on all the ally cards is a person that is grey).
    
Encounters – The requirement to defeat the encounter is listed on the bottom half of each encounter. Some encounters give bonuses or require costs. The number in the top right corner is the amount of Honor earned from defeating that Encounter. Some encounters have icons with a “?”, indicating any type superhero may be used in that requirement.

Henchman Tokens – Henchman tokens are represented by the white meeple tokens. They represent a henchman being captured who can share valuable information to you, making it easier to defeat encounters in the future. Each Henchman token counts as a “?” icon when defeating encounters. You do NOT return Henchman tokens to the supply when they are used, they remain with you for the rest of the round and may be used on multiple encounters. Multiple henchman can be used on an encounter, up to as many “?” icons that are on that encounter.

Planning Tokens - Planning Tokens are represented by the star tokens. They represent valuable foresight and information you have gained to more easily defeat encounters. When a planning token is used to help defeat an encounter, it is returned to the planning token supply card. Planning tokens count as a “wild” superhero while defeating encounters. They may be spent to replace any icon on an encounter. Any number of Planning tokens may be spent at one time.

Bystander Tokens – Bystanders are represented by the purple meeple tokens. Each one of these tokens counts as one Honor at the end of the round.

—description from the designer

Name: Risk: Call of Duty Zombies
Description:
The legendary zombie demolition crew is back in a classic game of strategic conquest. This custom RISK edition features factions led by "Tank” Dempsey, Edward Richtofen, Takeo Masaki, and Nikolai Belinski as they vie for control over familiar maps. Use Pack-a-Punch cards to gain an advantage against opponents and fend off wave after wave of zombie threats. Experience one of the first Call of Duty table top games that combine the legendary atmosphere of the license with the strategic competition of RISK.

—description from the publisher

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Ready for Anything 2
Description:
The ultimate set of Robinson Crusoe promos and mini-expansions is back, stronger than ever! Get your hands on all of those RC promos AT ONCE!

That's new scenarios, new wooden components, new characters, a lot of new cards, and much more!

Make your collection fill by expanding it with:

     Robinson Crusoe: Gamer stickers and pawns
     Robinson Crusoe: Hunting Adventures - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Shelter upgrades - Mini expansions
     Robinson Crusoe: Mystery cards - Mini expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Secret Trait Cards - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Design your own expansion - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Herb Garden & Pen - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: "Poachers" scenario - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Crewmen - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: "Treasure Island" scenario - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: new character: Sailor + additional stickers and pawns - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Searching the Beach - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Additional Beast Cards
     Robinson Crusoe: Trait Cards I - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Trait Cards II - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Discovery Tokens with a bag - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: "Tracing Dr. Livingstone" scenario - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Stickers and Pawns for HMS Beagle Characters - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Event Cards - Mini Expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: "Time Travel" scenario - Mini-expansion
     Robinson Crusoe: Wooden Fish Tokens - Mini-expansion
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Go F**k Yourself!
Description:
An offensive and immature party game for adults who hate each other.

The aim of Go F**k Yourself! is to collect as many full sets (four of a kind) as possible. There are thirteen different sets in the deck and the player with the most at the end is the winner.

Shuffle the deck and deal five cards to each player and place the remaining deck in the centre of the table. Player 1 (Joe) can only asks for cards in his hand and asks Player 2; "Mary, have you got... A huge dick but no hands?" If Mary has one or more of this card she must hand them all over to Joe. He can now ask Mary for a different card or any other player for the same or a different card from his hand. When a player does not have the card asked for they reply; "Go F**k Yourself!" Joe must then take one card from the top of the deck and play continues clockwise. When a player completes a full set of cards they must place them on the table in front of them. Note: If a players hand becomes empty at any point they must take one new card from the deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Expande Negocios
Description:
Expande Negocios is aimed at students, employees, professionals, entrepreneurs, business owners and investors. Expande Negocios consists of 3 levels by which players perform in a simulated way step by step to grow as great employees, to be owners of their own businesses and become investors, to achieve the much longed for financial freedom. Expande Negocios is a board game that teaches you to create business skills, such as negotiation, sales, detect opportunities, strategies, decision making etc. The person or people who can obtain a "Mega Investment" win(s) the game.
—description from the publisher

Players begin at the inner part of the game board, at the employee level. They roll dice to move their way around a route of fields with descriptions. At this level, they receive a small regular salary and have to gather enough money to start their own business. 
At the second (business owner) level, they will use their money from the first level to run their own businesses. This requires negotiation with other players. The goal is to systematize or automate their businesses so they can be promoted to the third and final level. 
At the investor level, players buy businesses and try to get rich enough for a mega investment. The first player(s) to manage that, wins the game.
—user summary

Name: The Potion Maker
Description:
You are the King's Master potion maker, but he's getting frustrated with your lack of progress in creating a special giant strength potion for his army.  So, you’ve been commissioned by the King to create the magic potion or else.  If you are unable to create the potion for the King, it's off to the dungeon with you!  You know that it takes a lot of gold to purchase the special ingredients needed for the magic potion.  Each potion you create will be valued in gold pieces and if you can create and sell enough potions to earn a total of 220 gold pieces, you will have enough gold to buy the special ingredients you need to create the magic potion.  There are six potion types you can create and sell to other kingdoms across the land.  As your workers travel the land, they will collect potion ingredients that you can mix together to create any of the six potions.  These potions can then be taken to nearby kingdoms and sold for gold.  You can also use your workers to help in the potion creation process.

Victory conditions
Sell enough potions in 15 turns to earn a total of 220 gp or greater giving you enough gold to purchase the required ingredients needed to create the magic potion for the King.

Losing conditions
Fail to earn 220 gp within the 15 turns needed and go directly to the King's dungeon, causing you to lose the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Krazy Klimber
Description:
In Crazy Climber, a giant Gorilla and his monkey minions have taken over a large building in New York City. You are the greatest Zoologist in the land and the city has hired you to tame the Gorilla and get the building back. Since the building has been taken over you must climb up the face of the building to reach the Giant Gorilla and take back the building. All the while the Gorilla and his monkey minions will be tossing thing down at you to try and knock you off the building.

The game consists of cards that are building sections, a top of the building and the main base level.  You can create different building types randomly.  Play is in turns and phases.  There are 8 phases to a turn.  Each turn a die will drop from the top of the building, a die will drop from out of a window on the building face.  These dice are what you have to avoid as you climb up the face of the building.  You can move up to two spaces on the building.  Each die has a falling speed represented by a number from 2 to 6 with 6 falling the fastest.  Each turn a vulture will fly across the building sections trying to knock you off.  If you can climb up to the top of the building and avoid being knocked off by the dice you win.  If you get knocked off you lose the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Das Siegel-Spiel
Description:
The players start at space 1. Movement is determined by a die or a spinning top (cut-out from the right side of the game map). On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the Siegel-Werke on space 60 wins the game.

This game was published between 1948 and 1952, while the Grenzlandring was an active racing track.

—user summary

Name: Mr Benn Grab!
Description:
Mr Benn Grab! is a card game that's laugh-out-loud fun for all the family. The game is based on the iconic Mr Benn animated cartoon series, but you don't need to be a fan of the show to play: the game is easy to learn and quick to play.

Mr Benn Grab! is a frantic race to see which player can collect the most of Mr Benn's exciting adventures - but watch out for the shopkeepers who will try to steal them before you can grab the souvenir cards to keep them safe.

Players score 1 point for every souvenir card grabbed, and the first player to get rid of all their adventure cards scores 3 points. The first to 10 points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hotel Transylania 3
Description: A children's spin/roll and move game based on the Hotel Transylvania franchise.  You play as one of the characters from the film and are running around a cruise ship collecting various travel accessories.

Name: Quodd Heroes: Promo Pack
Description:
Promo pack contains 3 promo cards.

- Thinkberry Extract: You may activate your Q-powers twice.
- Swiftgrass Extract: +6 to any movement skill.
- Gummy Extract: Double your jump skill.

Released at conventions in 2018.

Name: Puerto Rico: Expansions 1&2 – The New Buildings & The Nobles
Description:
Puerto Rico: Expansions 1&2 includes two previously released expansions in a single package:

• The New Buildings adds forests to the game and introduces the following new buildings: Aqueduct, Forest House, Black Market, Storehouse, Guesthouse, Church, Trading Post, Small Wharf, Lighthouse, Library, Speciality Factory, Union Hall, Cloister, and Statue. These buildings can be mixed and matched with the existing building in the Puerto Rico base game.

• The Nobles includes tokens that are used like colonists, but some of the seven new buildings provide different properties depending on whether they are occupied by nobles or colonists.

Name: Rhyme Time
Description:
Gameplay in Rhyme Time is simple. Turn six cards from the deck face up so that all players can see the 24 pictures of simple objects on these cards. At the same time, all players start looking for objects whose names rhyme with one another, such as shampoo – kangaroo or doll – ball. Everybody is trying to be the first one to find a pair that rhymes, and the first one to do so claims the two cards showing the rhyming objects and places these cards in their victory pile. Someone then reveals two more cards, and the game continues.

Once all the cards from the deck have been used, and no one can discover more rhyming pairs, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins.

Name: Forest Adventure
Description: Forest Adventure is a collecting and memory game.

Name: See the Sea
Description:
See the Sea is a classic bingo game with sea animals for the youngest players. Three versions of the game are included:


    2+ years: to get know undersea world
    3-5 years: classic bingo game - draw the tockens and fill your field.
    4-7 years: bingo+memory with die. Roll the die and open as many chips as you have on the die. Get open animals from your field and be the first who complete it.


Perfect simplicity to enjoy time together with youngest kids.

Name: Bargain Quest: Solo Mode
Description: Bargain Quest: Solo Mode is a Bargain Quest expansion pack that contains twenty competitor cards and all the rules needed to enjoy Bargain Quest as a solo experience!

Name: The Big Movie Quiz
Description: It's time to put your knowledge of the big screen to the test with this ultimate movie quiz! Compete with friends and family to answer questions on everything from classic movie lines, the catchiest film soundtracks and the biggest movie stars, and see who will be a Hollywood hit and who will be a box office flop. Lights, camera, action! Includes 300 movie questions on action movies, comedy classics and Oscar winners.

Name: The War: The Pacific 1941-45
Description:
The War: The Pacific, 1941-1945 (“TWP”) simulates the military, naval, economic, diplomatic and political aspects of World War II in the Asia and the Pacific theatres. It may be played on its own or may be combined with The War: Europe 1939-1945 (“TWE”) to recreate the entire Second World War. In conjunction with The War’s Expansion Kit, gamers can now enjoy the complete TW franchise. The game includes TW: Global rules linking the Asia/Pacific and European theaters.

The War: The Pacific, 1941-1945 borrows many concepts from TWE, so experienced TWE gamers will readily adapt to TWP’s game system. However, TWP doesn’t just port European Theater rules to the Pacific and hope for the best. The game features sophisticated carrier-warfare rules that capture the unique features of the Allied naval struggle against Japan. Further, TWP isn’t just a naval strategy contest. Unlike some WWII strategy games, Nationalist China plays an active role in TWP, and a player’s diplomatic strategy in China may be as important as his military strategy.

As in TWE, there are numerous optional rules and variants, from the Doolittle raid to Japanese Fleet suicide missions. Scenarios include Changsha (Nationalist China vs. Japan, Fall 1939); Guadalcanal; Coral Sea; Midway; the Eastern Solomons; Leyte; Okinawa, 1941-1945 Pacific War Campaign; 1942-1943 Turning Point; and TW-Global, combining TWP and TWE into one monster campaign game.

Playing times range from less an hour for the smallest scenarios up to 40-50 hours for the full campaign. For those who want to run the full Europe-Pacific campaign, joining both games together, you’ll need about 80 hours to recreate all of World War Two.

Product Information:

Complexity: High (about 8 out of 10)
    Solitaire Suitability: Good
    Time Scale: 1 turn = 2 months
    Map Scale: 1 hex = 46 miles or 75 km
    Unit Scale: Fleets and Task-Forces; Air: Wings; Land: Divisions, Corps and Army
    Players: two
    Playing Time: 50 hours for full campaign (1.5 hours and up for scenarios)

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Monopoly: The Golden Girls
Description:
The Golden Girls Edition of Monopoly offers fans of the Emmy Award-winning show a unique game play experience as they buy, sell and trade iconic locations from the show while enjoying one of America's all-time favorite board games.

Unique board to reflect the classic television series the Golden Girls, Iconic Golden Girls tokens to travel along the Monopoly board .

—description from the publisher

Name: CURRENCY SAKANA
Description:
Currency Sakana is a linen bag of metal coins, that allows for a variety of games with mechanics such as bidding, dexterity, and variable player powers.

In the first game "It's in the Bag", players will all start with a set number of yen bills and coins equaling 7,500 yen. Players will always add one currency item to the bag (it is never allowed to make change), and then hold a blind bid for the contents. All bids are then placed to the side to be added to the bag for the next bidding round, and the highest bidder takes all of the current yen in the bag. Play continues like this, with players bidding on the last rounds bids plus one new currency item from each player, until one player has 10,000 yen or more and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lost in R'lyeh: Strange Laws Beyond Our Ken Promo Card
Description:
If you buy Lost in R'lyeh at your friendly local game store and send in a selfie of you at check-out, Atlas Games will mail you a free promo card featuring Ken Hite and Robin Laws — of award-winning podcast Ken and Robin Talk About Stuff — called "Strange Laws Beyond Our Ken."

This adds a new Event card for the game, the text of which reads "Each player still in the game chooses an Escape card from the player to their right and adds it to their hand. If that player doesn't have any, none are added."

Name: Conflict of Alliances: Three Kingdoms
Description:
Conflict of Alliances: Three Kingdomsï¼ˆé­æ­¦ä¸‰å›½ï¼‰is a 2 or 4 player (does not support 3) game about diplomacy and warfare in the period of the Three Kingdoms in ancient China.

This game integrates diplomacy, warfare, reinforcements and initiative in a simple card driven mechanic. Each player plays actions by the cards in their hand and tries to control more areas by the end of game.

The game has different winning goals for each scenario.

Name: Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms Ver. Lord
Description:
Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms Ver. Lord is a board game that allows you play as a lord in Three Kingdoms. The game also support AI batter for 0 player.

There are 4 seasons in a round. In each round, player should bid different actions and active them. Players are trying to control the most areas to win the game.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Hidden Paths
Description:
Hidden Paths is an abstract/spacial puzzle game for 2 to 4 players.  In Hidden Paths, players are lost in a mysterious forest and are attempting to escape.  Players play pattern cards to the Forest Core for placing path cubes that will eventually scoring points.  Players can also play pattern cards in the Market to collect resources and other pattern cards to build up their hand.  After scoring pattern cards, that pattern card scored is used to create your path out of the forest using your personal map.  Each colored square you explore - you gain points, immediate resources and/or step closer to unlocking additional personal upgrades and finding your way to victory!

—description from the designer

Name: Small Indigo Plant
Description:
A new one of micro-game series made by Jog Kung.

In this game, each player tries to dye the clothes in his/her indigo plant, first from white cloth to blue cloth, then to patterned cloth. The one who successfully dyed 8 patterned clothes first wins the game!

Players take turn to do one of the following:
1. Take a card from the supply and place it on his/her plant.
2. Take a card from the supply and add it to his/her hand.
3. Place a card from his/her hand to his/her plant.

The game ends when one of the following happens:
1. One of the player has dyed 8 or more patterned clothes.
2. There is only 1 card in any of the supply rows.

Name: Sherlock Holmes Detektyw doradczy: Nie ma zysku bez ryzyka
Description:
Inspector Gregson came to Baker Street for help from Sherlock with a case of a girl that dies in hospital yesterday. She was beaten to death.

Sherlock Holmes: Detektyw doradczy - Nie ma zysku bez ryzyka (Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective - Nothing ventured, nothing gained) is a free print and play scenario for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective!

This is a standalone game. It comes with an excerpt from the address book, map, and newspaper, and does not need any items from the base game.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Warriors of the Wind: Unicorn Clan Pack
Description:
For almost 300 years the Unicorn Clan have settled in Rokugan, yet still they retain much of the wildness and gaijin customs that set them apart from the other Great Clans. It's not that they are unable to assimilate, but rather have learned in their travels to remain true to themselves.

Warriors of the Wind contains 78 new cards (three copies of twenty-five different cards and one copy each of three different cards), many of which provide new tools to the Unicorn Clan! This Clan Pack celebrates all that makes the Unicorn great. Look for a Stronghold that rewards you for exploring your opponent's lands, MeishÅdÅ events that protect your characters from harm, and battle steeds for the Utaku cavalry!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Masters of the Court: Crane Clan Pack
Description:
Amidst the honorable samurai of the Emerald Empire, none stand quite as virtuously as those of the Crane Clan. It is by the grace and excellence of the Left Hand of the Emperor that peace is maintained, for their mastery of law and diplomacy is unparalleled. The descendants of Lady Doji helped codify the laws that govern life in the Empire, simultaneously defining the social order and modeling it with elegance.

Masters of the Court contains 78 new cards (three copies of twenty-five different cards and one copy each of three different cards), many of which provide new tools to the Crane Clan!

Masters of the Court celebrates all that makes the Crane great. Look for a Stronghold that brings dueling to the forefront, events that suppress your opponent's options, and courtiers dominating the courts of Rokugan!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Gondor at War
Description:
At the end of the Third Age, Gondor was the greatest remaining land of Men, the last bulwark of might standing against the growing darkness of Mordor. As Sauron's armies were unleashed and the War of the Ring began, it was Gondor that stood against the might of the Orcish hordes and their dark allies. And it was before the gates of the White City, on the Pelennor Fields, that the tides of war would turn, as the rightful king returned and heroes rose and fell…

This expansion for the Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game focuses on the the events of the Dark Lord Sauron's assault on the kingdom of Gondor during the War of the Ring. It features background on Gondor and the White City of Minas Tirith, along with a wealth of new rules, scenarios, profiles and a campaign that allows you to refight some of the greatest battles of the Third Age with your collection of Citadel and Forge World miniatures.

Inside this 128-page hardback book, you will find:


     History of Gondor: A guide to the realm, from its founding by Elendil to the Third Age and the coming of King Elessar
     Scenarios: 29 narrative play scenarios ranging in size from small skirmishes to mighty clashes let you refight your favourite battles from the books and films, from the fall of Osgiliath to the Battle of the Black Gate.
     Gondor at War Campaign: Link the scenarios together into a flowing campaign, with each battle having an impact on others.
     Armies: Background, tactics and army lists for Minas Tirith, Rohan, The Fiefdoms, The Dead of Dunharrow, Mordor, The Serpent Horde, Far Harad and the Corsairs of Umbar. Includes new profiles for a range of Heroes.
     Legendary Legions: 8 stand-alone army lists representing the forces that fought in famous battles of the War of the Ring: Rangers of Ithilien, The Grey Company, The Return of the King, The Riders of Théoden, The Men of the West, The Army of Gothmog, Grand Army of the South, and The Black Gate Opens
     Miniatures showcase: A selection of Citadel and Forge World models for each of the armies in this book.


—description from the publisher
Families: Fictional Events: Battle of the Pelennor Fields

Name: Clumsy Thief in the Candy Shop
Description:
From the creators of the original, award-winning Clumsy Thief game, this hilarious version has players snatching candy stacks that add to 20. All candy is up for grabs in this fast-paced card game. Strategy, addition skills, luck and a great sense of humor are required.

HOW TO PLAY: Players make candy stacks from their dealt cards. Take a players' stack if you have a card that makes 20 when added to the top card of their stack. But that's just the beginning! Thief cards steal candy cards. Jail cards stop thief cards. In the end, the player with the most candy cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ganjifa Play
Description:
Ganjifa playing cards were introduced and popularized by Mughal emperors in the 16th century. It has always been one of the popular card games among Moghul Emperors, Emirs and Maharajas. When it was first established, the cards started spreading to many regions of India in the original form or Hindu form. Nowadays it’s difficult to find a suitable deck to play in India. Only a small handful of artisans located in 2 cities still produce Ganjifa cards.

This is where we come in. Let me introduce you to Ganjifa Play.

In Ganjifa Play, players take turns playing suits, taking tricks, and building temples. Ganjifa Play is a trick-taking, hand management game for 2-4 players. Several chips are randomly drawn from the bag to determine (one round, one square, and one diamond) the highest suite symbol that round, the time of day, and the location.

The Round pawn sets the highest deck in the game for that round. The Raja of this suit goes first.

The Diamond pawn, with the time of day symbol indicates the suit that defines the direction of the game. For example, the player whose Raja matches the chosen time of day makes the toughest decision. Does gameplay go Clockwise or Counterclockwise?

The Square pawn defines the location. The players who Raja matches may exchange two cards of their choice with any two from an opponent’s hand.

Once all cards have been played, players count their tricks to determine the winner that round. The winner places the base of their temple onto the mandala playing field. If a number of players have the same number of tricks, all players are deemed winners that round and should put the first part of their temple on the playing field.

The goal is to be the first player to build a complete temple made up of three parts.

—description from the designer

Name: The Cleveland Experience
Description:
The object of this game is for the PLAYERS, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a RESIDENCE SQUARE to the shopping locations shown on their SHOPPING LISTS. The first PLAYER to return to his RESIDENCE with TRAVEL CARDS for all locations on his SHOPPING LIST wins the game!
—description from the rulebook

The gameboard, which comes in six puzzle-like pieces, depicts a highly simplified map of Cleveland, Ohio, with featured local landmarks. The instructions pamphlet has contact information for Cleveland attractions printed in the margins. In addition to the game components, real-world coupons are also included for Cleveland businesses that were around when the game was made in 1980.
—user summary

Name: Stations
Description:
Deliver your customers to stations situated all across town, and be the first to get them to each before your competition in this latest title from famed game designer, Reiner Knizia.

In Stations, players will compete to be the first to visit seven stations, represented by colored discs on both the board and in front of them. The first player to get rid of all their discs wins. On the way, they collect tickets to help them maneuver around the board, hop off one transport and make their way to the next transport that will take them where they need to go. But watch out! If you're waiting at the station hoping to hop on the next "shuttle", the transport might just pass you by!

Stations is part of the Age Fluid series of games with gameplay that is, at once, perfect for entire families and can be built up to appeal to the more serious gamer. The game comes with the base rules and variants designed to make the strategy ramp up.

Name: Dodoresque: Cherry Blossom
Description:
Dodoresque: Cherry Blossom is a funny card game for 2-4 players. Each Player takes the role of a Dodo, trying to build the best nest possible.

To do so, the Dodos can go on Adventures, Trade and Build.

Each player starts out with the drawing of 3 starting cards, of which one is discarded to create the exchange stack.

To gather nest building materials, the Dodo Players have to go on Adventures in one of three card stacks (drawing cards). Those stacks consist of 2 different card types: Material and Action. To get better material cards, you need the right action cards on your hand to counter certain effects and be able to take the materials on your hand. Material cards from your hand can be built into a nest by playing them on the table in front of you. A nest consists of a maximum of 6 cards. Goal of the game is to score as many points as possible with different combinations of cards in your nest.

Another option to get the cards you need is to trade with other players, but not in a direct way. Depending on the number of players there are some cards available as an exchange stack. Players can trade cards from their hand with the exchange stack.

Each material card has one of three types, one of four themes and an individual value between 1 and 3. To build the perfect nest you require 2 cards of each type, preferably of the same theme and with an individual value as high as possible.

The game ends when one of the adventure card stacks is used up or one of the Dodo characters has lost all of its hit points.

Dodoresque consists of 90 cards, over 60 of them with unique artworks of our Dodos and their adventures.

While the mechanics of Cherry Blossom are the same as in the first Dodoresque, the game has all new illustrations, characters, landscapes, and some new special action cards.

Dodoresque: Cherry Blossom can be combined with Dodoresque: Jungle Fever for a game with up to 8 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trinity
Description:
Trinity is an abstract two player strategy game where you can exercise your tactical expertise and pattern recognition skills to capture your opponent. The game is designed to be compact, yet engaging for ease-of-travel and making more use of downtime during your adventures.

Players have 5 tokens each and can either place a token, move a token, or place a dead space on the board. You capture your opponent's token by maneuvering your own to restrict their movement. The opponent then receives a dead space token to potentially turn the tides. A player wins when 3 of the opponent's tokens are captured.

-description from designer
